thread.title: Lynnwood will host public hearing on Shell oil trains
thread.title_full: Lynnwood will host public hearing on Shell oil trains | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Lynnwood will host public hearing on Shell oil trains
text:
The state of Washington wants to know what residents think should be considered while reviewing a proposal from Shell that could bring more trains carrying crude oil through the area.
The Everett Herald reports that the state Department of Ecology will hold a public hearing in Lynnwood for Snohomish County residents before its upcoming review of Shell's proposed refinery project in Anacortes.
The Monday meeting is the third session meant to help the agency and Skagit County decide what to cover in the project's environmental impact study. Department of Ecology spokesman Larry Altose says 350 people attended previous hearings in Mount Vernon and Anacortes.
According to the proposal, Shell's project could mean as many as six oil trains with 102 cars each passing through Snohomish County each week.
